00024 // the data format of each sample for training/testing
00025 struct ME_Sample
00026 {
00027   std::string label;
00028   std::vector<std::string> features;
00029 };

00068   struct ME_Feature
00069   {
00070     ME_Feature(const int l, const int f) : _body((l << 24) + f) {
00071       assert(l >= 0 && l < 256);
00072       assert(f >= 0 && f <= 0xffffff);
00073     };
00074     int label() const { return _body >> 24; }
00075     int feature() const { return _body & 0xffffff; }
00076     unsigned int body() const { return _body; }
00077   private:
00078     unsigned int _body;
00079   };
00080 
00081   struct ME_FeatureBag
00082   {
00083 #ifdef USE_HASH_MAP
00084     typedef __gnu_cxx::hash_map<unsigned int, int> map_type;
00085 #else    
00086     typedef std::map<unsigned int, int> map_type;
00087 #endif
00088     map_type mef2id;
00089     std::vector<ME_Feature> id2mef;
00090     int Put(const ME_Feature & i) {
00091       map_type::const_iterator j = mef2id.find(i.body());
00092       if (j == mef2id.end()) {
00093         int id = id2mef.size();
00094         id2mef.push_back(i);
00095         mef2id[i.body()] = id;
00096         return id;
00097       }
00098       return j->second;
00099     }
00100     int Id(const ME_Feature & i) const {
00101       map_type::const_iterator j = mef2id.find(i.body());
00102       if (j == mef2id.end()) {
00103         return -1;
00104       }
00105       return j->second;
00106     }
00107     ME_Feature Feature(int id) const {
00108       assert(id >= 0 && id < (int)id2mef.size());
00109       return id2mef[id];
00110     }
00111     int Size() const {
00112       return id2mef.size();
00113     }
00114     void Clear() {
00115       mef2id.clear();
00116       id2mef.clear();
00117     }
00118   };
00119 
00120   struct hashfun_str
00121   {
00122     size_t operator()(const std::string& s) const {
00123       assert(sizeof(int) == 4 && sizeof(char) == 1);
00124       const int* p = reinterpret_cast<const int*>(s.c_str());
00125       size_t v = 0;
00126       int n = s.size() / 4;
00127       for (int i = 0; i < n; i++, p++) {
00128         //      v ^= *p;
00129         v ^= *p << (4 * (i % 2)); // note) 0 <= char < 128
00130       }
00131       int m = s.size() % 4;
00132       for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
00133         v ^= s[4 * n + i] << (i * 8);
00134       }
00135       return v;
00136     }
00137   };
00138 
00139   struct MiniStringBag
00140   {
00141 #ifdef USE_HASH_MAP
00142     typedef __gnu_cxx::hash_map<std::string, int, hashfun_str> map_type;
00143 #else    
00144     typedef std::map<std::string, int> map_type;
00145 #endif
00146     int _size;
00147     map_type str2id;
00148     MiniStringBag() : _size(0) {}
00149     int Put(const std::string & i) {
00150       map_type::const_iterator j = str2id.find(i);
00151       if (j == str2id.end()) {
00152         int id = _size;
00153         _size++;
00154         str2id[i] = id;
00155         return id;
00156       }
00157       return j->second;
00158     }
00159     int Id(const std::string & i) const {
00160       map_type::const_iterator j = str2id.find(i);
00161       if (j == str2id.end())  return -1;
00162       return j->second;
00163     }
00164     int Size() const { return _size; }
00165     void Clear() { str2id.clear(); _size = 0; }
00166     map_type::const_iterator begin() const { return str2id.begin(); }
00167     map_type::const_iterator end()   const { return str2id.end(); }
00168   };
00169 
00170   struct StringBag : public MiniStringBag
00171   {
00172     std::vector<std::string> id2str;
00173     int Put(const std::string & i) {
00174       map_type::const_iterator j = str2id.find(i);
00175       if (j == str2id.end()) {
00176         int id = id2str.size();
00177         id2str.push_back(i);
00178         str2id[i] = id;
00179         return id;
00180       }
00181       return j->second;
00182     }
00183     std::string Str(const int id) const {
00184       assert(id >= 0 && id < (int)id2str.size());
00185       return id2str[id];
00186     }
00187     int Size() const { return id2str.size(); }
00188     void Clear() {
00189       str2id.clear();
00190       id2str.clear();
00191     }
00192   };
